main_definition: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) is a reference or address that specifies the location of a resource, such as web page, file, or data on the internet.

meanings_and_examples.example: The URL 'https://www.google.com' is an Internet address that allows users to access Google's homepage.
When you click on a link, the web page identifier in the URL directs your browser to display that specific webpage.
The file 'data.csv' located at 'https://www.samplewebsite.com/files/data.csv' can be accessed using its URL.
